page.title: 02WEAVERHAM
page.content: { Weaverham}is a village with houses of timber and thatch.It is close to the River Weaver in rural Cheshire. It appears in the original Domesday as a large settlement with a priest and a church.In the Middle Ages it was part of Vale Royal Abbey lands with a gaol belonging to the Abbot. 1851 Census{1639}growing to{7471}in 1981.This came with the growth of Council estates in the 20th c.The first sponsored by ICI and Northwich RDC in 1938. Weaverham's salt came from springs as far back as Saxon times.Today there is only light and service industries and agriculture. The Parish church is largely 15th c. It keeps its Parish Registers which go back to the 16th c. in the church safe.
